question: What is the required frequency of testing the GMDSS EPIRB?
explanation:
According to SOLAS Chapter IV, Regulation 15.9:

“EPIRBs shall be tested at intervals not exceeding one month, using the means provided on the device, to ensure that they are capable of operating properly.”

Source: IMO Resolution A.702(17) and MSC/Circ.1040/Rev.1.

Annual testing by authorised personnel includes:
- Inspection of battery expiry
- Check of hydrostatic release expiry
- Confirmation of correct registration
- Performance check and programming verification

Which of the following position fixing methods can be used to obtain an accurate position fix on a coastal passage?
options: Radar ranges and bearings of charted objects.
Contour line on the echo sounder
Three radar bearings from conspicuous points.
Two visual bearings of charted objects.
explanation:
• Radar ranges and bearings of charted objects. This is correct.
• Contour line on the echo sounder. Comparing echo sounder readings to the contours on the chart is a method of obtaining an approximate position but it will not be an accurate position fix by itself.
• Three radar bearings from conspicuous points. This is correct.
• Two visual bearings of charted objects. A minimum of three lines of position are required for an accurate position fix.
